CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 1, 1945, pg. 13, reads: "Big Splash - One of the biggest parties of the season was held at the Ritz Cafe recently in honor of "Shimmy," one of the Hill Distric's most colorful characters.  A large crowd attended, and plenty of champagne food was provided to keep the guests in a happy mood."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait including Charles "Snotty" Lewis, his wife Mary Louise Harris Lewis, Edna Lewis Williams and her daughter Ethel Littlejohn, and unknown seated in front row, and possibly Clayton "Shimmy" Bandy wearing horse patterned tie in rear, gathered behind pushed together tables with  plaid tablecloths and champagne glasses, possibly in the Ritz Cafe
